summary: This document is a telephone call detail record from AT&T, produced in response to a query on June 18, 2019. It lists hundreds of calls from January to March 2002, showing originating and terminating numbers, dates, times, and durations. The document is marked confidential and appears to be part of the evidence in the Epstein case, likely showing communication patterns. This document is a detailed AT&T telephone call log, likely subpoenaed by law enforcement, covering calls from March 7, 2002, to May 30, 2002. It shows frequent calls between specific phone numbers, including a pattern of calls between numbers 732 and 110/129, and several long-duration calls to area code 288. The log was run on June 18, 2019, indicating it was part of a later investigation. This document is a confidential AT&T wireline telephone record, likely subpoenaed by the SDNY, showing detailed call logs for a specific number (associated with code 129) from May 31, 2002, to August 27, 2002. It includes call times, durations, and carrier codes, indicating a pattern of communication relevant to an investigation. This document is a detailed AT&T telephone call log, likely subpoenaed by law enforcement, covering the period from January 1, 2002, to December 31, 2006. It shows numerous calls between specific phone numbers, with timestamps, durations, and call codes, indicating patterns of communication relevant to the investigation. This document is a series of AT&T telephone call detail records, likely subpoenaed by law enforcement, covering the period from January 1, 2002, to December 31, 2006. It shows detailed logs of calls including timestamps, durations, and call codes, indicating a pattern of communication that was of investigative interest. This document is a confidential AT&T wireline call detail record, produced for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) on 06/18/2019. It contains detailed logs of telephone calls from 01/01/2002 to 12/31/2006, showing originating/terminating numbers, dates, times, and durations. It appears to be evidence in the Epstein investigation, likely tracking communications of persons of interest. This document is a confidential AT&T wireline call detail record, produced for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) on June 18, 2019. It contains detailed logs of telephone calls from March to September 2004, showing originating and terminating numbers, call durations, and codes, likely as part of a subpoena or investigation into communications during that period. This document is a confidential AT&T wireline call detail record, produced on June 18, 2019, in response to a query for records from January 1, 2002, to December 31, 2006. It contains a log of numerous phone calls, showing originating and terminating numbers, dates, times, and durations, likely as part of a law enforcement investigation into the Epstein case. This document is a confidential AT&T wireline telephone record query, run on June 18, 2019, covering call detail records from January 1, 2002, to December 31, 2006. It contains a detailed log of calls with timestamps, originating and terminating numbers, and call durations, likely subpoenaed for the Epstein investigation to establish communication patterns.

keyFacts: AT&T telephone records were queried by law enforcement on June 18, 2019, covering the period from January 1, 2002, to December 31, 2006.
The detailed call log shows hundreds of calls from January to March 2002, including originating and terminating numbers, dates, times, and durations.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) evidence set related to the Epstein case.
The records are stored and provided in OTC (likely a reference to a specific time zone or record format).
No specific individuals are named in this chunk; the data consists of phone numbers and call metadata.
The document is a confidential AT&T wireline call log, marked for use by authorized persons only and part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files.
The log covers a specific period from March to May 2002, showing a high volume of calls, including many very short (0-2 second) calls and several long-duration calls (some over 40 minutes).
A clear calling pattern exists between originating number 732 and terminating numbers 110 and 129, often in quick succession (e.g., calls 497 & 498, 589 & 590).
Multiple calls are made to area code 288, with some lasting over 20-30 minutes, indicating potentially significant contacts.
The record was generated on June 18, 2019, confirming it was obtained years later as part of an ongoing investigation into activities during the early 2000s.
The document is a confidential AT&T wireline record subpoenaed by the Southern District of New York (SDNY), as indicated by the 'CONFIDENTIAL SDNY_GM' header.

It details hundreds of telephone calls from a specific number (associated with carrier code 129) between May 31, 2002, and August 27, 2002, showing call times, durations, and other carrier codes (e.g., 732, 288, 306, 343).
The records were queried by AT&T on June 18, 2019, for a date range from January 1, 2002, to December 31, 2006, indicating a broad investigative scope.
The call logs show frequent, sometimes lengthy calls (e.g., a 43-minute call on 08/13/02, a 48-minute call on 08/24/02), suggesting sustained communication patterns.
The document is part of a larger set, as indicated by the file name 'EFTA01264412.pdf' and page numbers 26-38, and references to other EFTA document numbers.
AT&T telephone records were queried for a five-year period from 2002 to 2006, indicating a broad investigative scope.
The call log shows frequent, sometimes lengthy, communications between specific phone numbers (e.g., numbers 129, 306, 288) during 2002.
The document is marked as confidential and for use by authorized persons only, confirming its status as evidence in the investigation.
The records were run on June 18, 2019, suggesting this data was compiled for a later stage of the investigation or legal proceedings.
Call codes (e.g., 11, 45, 134, 343) are present, which may categorize the type of call or service, but their specific meaning is not defined in the provided text.
AT&T telephone records covering a five-year period (2002-2006) were queried on June 18, 2019, indicating an active investigation into communications during that timeframe.

The records are detailed call logs showing originating and terminating numbers, call times, durations, and various call codes (e.g., CIC, Call Code, Orig. Ace.), which are used for billing and routing analysis.
The document is marked as CONFIDENTIAL and for use by authorized persons only, confirming its status as part of a law enforcement or legal proceeding.
The records are stored and provided in OTC (likely a reference to a time zone or data format) and queried using Eastern Time Zone.
The sheer volume of logged calls (over 2400 entries in this excerpt) suggests a focus on a specific telephone number or set of numbers for pattern-of-life analysis or contact tracing.
